description:
The '''Venezuelan bambuco''' is a musical genre is typical of the [[Andes|Andean]] region of Venezuela.  It is also found in the States of [[Zulia]], [[Bolívar (state)|Bolívar]], [[Lara (state)|Lara]] and in the Capital District ([[Caracas]]). The instruments typically used are [[piano]], bass and [[guitar]], and sometimes mandolin and flute. Venezuelan bambuco is typically played in a {{music|time|5|8}} [[Metre (music)|meter]].

Characteristic pieces include: "Mañanitas Navidenas" by Marco Antonio Useche, "Brisas del Torbes" by [[Luis Felipe Ramón y Rivera]], “Tu Partida” by Augusto Brandt, “Serenata” by Manuel Enrique Perez
Diaz and “Hendrina” by Napoleón Lucena.
